intro: Cirsium eriophoroideum, commonly known as the western thistle, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disk florets, which are typical of the daisy family. Cirsium eriophoroideum is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, where it thrives in full sun.
